business.headline: Where are ITR-2 and ITR-3 forms? Why they're missing and what to doIt's ITR season but many taxpayers can't find the ITR-2 and ITR-3 forms on the Income Tax portal yet. If you have capital gains, foreign income or business income, this delay might worry you. The good news is there's an extended deadline this year. Here's why these forms are missing and what you should do next.

SBI credit card rules changing from July 15: Here's what cardholders must knowAt present, many cardholders pay only a small part of their bill to avoid late charges. But now, the way the minimum amount due (MAD) is calculated will change starting July 15, 2025.

One in 4 Indians still below minimum standard of living: World BankDespite a sharp drop in extreme poverty, about one in four Indians still falls below the level needed to meet essential needs and maintain a minimum standard of living.

Sebi bans Jane Street for stock market manipulation. Here's what went wrongSecurities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) said the trades executed by the group were "prima facie fraudulent and manipulative" and violated the country's capital market regulations.

Want Rs 36 lakh in 5 years? Know who can avail this government schemeThis government scheme offers guaranteed returns, so you don't have to worry about market ups and downs. For the current quarter, the interest rate is fixed at 7.7% per year.

Why did Soham Parekh work multiple jobs? Indian techie shares his reasonsHe confirmed that he worked at several companies simultaneously and misrepresented his location and employment status in the process.

Gold gathering dust in locker? Financial advisor explains how to make it workA financial advisor has warned that family gold stored in lockers faces risk from rust, floods, and poor insurance. He explains how a scheme can offer safety and steady returns instead.

EPF, NPS can build Rs 12 crore retirement fund. Tax expert breaks it downFor salaried individuals earning up to Rs 14.65 lakh annually, Bangar believes this combination offers the best of both worlds: zero tax under the new regime and long-term wealth creation.
Sensex opens 82 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Bajaj Finance up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 46.97 points to 83,286.44, while the NSE Nifty50 added 14.45 points to 25,419.75 as of 9:22 am.

HCLTech joins hands with OpenAI to take AI to businessesThe collaboration aims to help global companies adopt AI at scale, combining HCLTech's industry experience with OpenAI's advanced AI models and tools.

Global trading firm Jane Street banned by Sebi from securities marketAccording to an order published on Sebi's website, the regulator has ordered the seizure of Rs 48.4 billion (approximately $570 million), which it claims is the total amount of illegal profit made by Jane Street.

DA hike July 2025: 4% increase likely for central government employeesDearness Allowance is revised twice a year, in January and July. It is based on the average of All India Consumer Price Index for Industrial Workers (AICPI-IW) data over the past 12 months.

entertainment.headline: Jurassic World Rebirth review: Dinosaurs, mayhem and visual treat with wobbly plotRelease Date:Fri Jul 04, 2025Jurassic World Rebirth movie review: The film returns with thrilling dinosaurs and suspenseful horror. The film impresses visually but struggles with an uneven plot and character development, says our review.

Sufi Motiwala on struggles of being queer Muslim: Asked ChatGPT if I am haramSufi Motiwala, a practising Muslim and queer content creator, shared his journey of reconciling faith and sexuality in a society that often challenges both. He emphasised finding peace through a personal connection with God and urged the LGBTQ+ community to focus on meaningful activism beyond stereotypes.

Vijay Deverakonda refused the opportunity to act in Kuberaa. Here's whyDhanush and Nagarjuna's 'Kuberaa', directed by Sekhar Kammula, is performing well in theatres. Before Dhanush, director Sekhar Kammula offered the role to Vijay Deverakonda.

We're retiring Kaanta Laga: Makers dismiss sequel reports after Shefali's death'Kaanta Laga' makers Radhika Rao and Vinay Sapru reacted to reports of the song's sequel after Shefali Jariwala's death. The duo, in a heartfelt post, wrote how they are retiring the song forever.

Twins Chinki-Minki, Surabhi and Samriddhi, announce professional split. Fans reactPopularly known as 'Chinki-Minki', influencer duo Surabhi and Samriddhi Mehra shared that they have decided to part ways professionally. They announced their decision on Instagram.

Aryan Khan visits dubbing studio with heavy security ahead of The Bads of BollywoodAryan Khan, son of Shah Rukh Khan, was seen arriving at a dubbing studio with heavy security as work continues on his directorial debut, 'The Bads of Bollywood'. The series will premiere on Netflix this year.

Actor Mahhi Vij reacts to separation rumours with Jay Bhanushali: Why should I tellMahhi Vij addressed rumours about her divorce with Jay Bhanushali, saying she doesn't owe anyone an explanation about her personal life. She slammed online speculation and urged people to "live and let live."

Difficult to change title: Janaki vs State of Kerala director on board's demandDirector Pravin Narayanan of 'Janaki vs State of Kerala' said that the censor board should look at a different perspective after the demand to change the film's title. The board wanted the makers to change 'Janaki' citing religious concerns.

Ranveer Singh beams with pride as queen Deepika Padukone gets Walk of Fame honourDeepika Padukone has made history as the first Indian actor to receive a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, marking a proud moment for Indian cinema. Ranveer Singh expressed his heartfelt pride and support.

Pics: Dhanush parties with Mrunal, Tamannaah and Bhumi as he wraps Tere Ishk MeinActor Dhanush had a great time partying with Tamannaah Bhatia, Bhumi Pednekar, Mrunal Thakur, and others as he wrapped his next film 'Tere Ishq Mein'. Directed by Aanand L Rai, the film also stars Kriti Sanon alongside the actor.

Sonakshi Sinha shares the funny reason behind her pregnancy rumoursSonakshi Sinha shared a funny WhatsApp chat with her husband Zaheer Iqbal to humourously address pregnancy rumours. They got married in June 2024.

Uorfi Javed, Nikita Luther win The Traitors, take home Rs 70.5 lakh cashUorfi Javed and Nikita Luther are the winners of the first season of 'The Traitors India'. The duo shared the prize of Rs 70.5 lakh after outsmarting competitors.

Metro In Dino review: Anurag Basu's film is like beauty of the first monsoon rainRelease Date:Fri Jul 04, 2025Metro In Dino movie review: Anurag Basu's 'Metro... In Dino' is a gentle reminder of how love seeps into everyday life, much like the first rain of the season. It's an anthology set in Indian metros, where characters feel heart-warmingly real. Basu creates a symphony of romance, regret, and rediscovery.

Diljit Dosanjh still a part of Border 2: Why film body lifted the ban on actorDiljit Dosanjh will continue to be part of 'Border 2' despite being banned by the film body. Producer Bhushan Kumar requested the association for special permission due to partial completion of the film.

Anshula Kapoor gets engaged, brother Arjun and sisters Janhvi, Khushi show loveAnshula Kapoor announced her engagement to longtime boyfriend Rohan Thakkar. They met on a dating app in 2022 and got engaged in New York.

Salman Khan's cryptic Hunar Ka Pehelwan post sparks buzz, fans predict comebackSalman Khan recently shared a picture of himself with an intense look on social media. Fans are predicting a comeback seeing his cryptic caption.

The Hunt review: A bold, unflinching thriller digging deep into Rajiv Gandhi caseRelease Date:Fri Jul 04, 2025The Hunt review: Director Nagesh Kukunoor's investigative-thriller 'The Hunt', featuring Amit Sial, is streaming on Sony Liv. The show chronicles the assassination of former Indian Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi on May 21, 1991. Does the show live up to expectations?

A frame everyone will remember: AR Rahman's selfie with Hans Zimmer stirs fan frenzy'Ramayana' marks an unprecedented collaboration between music maestros AR Rahman and Hans Zimmer. Rahman shared a heartwarming selfie with the Hollywood music legend on Thursday.

Kaalidhar Laapata review: Abhishek Bachchan shines but film falls shortRelease Date:Fri Jul 04, 2025Kaalidhar Laapata movie review: The Zee5 film follows a middle-aged man with memory loss who escapes abandonment and forms a unique bond with an orphan boy. Set in Madhya Pradesh, it explores themes of abandonment and healing but misses some emotional beats.

general news.headline: China gave Pak live inputs on our vectors during Op Sindoor: Top Army generalTop Army general Rahul Singh said that during Operation Sindoor, India tackled a double whammy at the border, as Pakistan received live inputs of New Delhi's important vectors from China.

India Today accesses Air India's crash compensation form amid coercion chargeA controversy has erupted over allegations by families of the Ahmedabad plane crash victims that they were pressured to make financial disclosures. Air India has denied the charges.

From Patna Street in Trinidad and Tobago, PM's subtle Bihar poll pushBhojpuri chautaal, dhol beats, and 38 ministers dressed in Indian attire, including a Prime Minister with roots in Bihar, welcomed PM Modi to Trinidad and Tobago. The optics were a perfect setting with the Bihar elections just months away.

Tamil Nadu Minister mocks Sanskrit ritual chants: Who the hell understands itTamil Nadu DMK Minister EV Velu sparked debate by mocking Sanskrit chants during rituals and questioned the understanding of the language. He also criticised the Union government's Rs 2,500 crore allocation for Sanskrit development while Tamil received just Rs 167 crore.

In Dino' is a gentle reminder of how love seeps into everyday life, much like the first rain of the season. It's an anthology set in Indian metros, where characters feel heart-warmingly real. Basu creates a symphony of romance, regret, and rediscovery.

Jinnah's out of the bottle in Maryam Nawaz renaming dramaThe Jinnah Institute of Cardiology in Lahore was named after Pakistan's founding father Muhammad Ali Jinnah. A bid to rename an extension of the hospital after Punjab Chief Minister Maryam Nawaz sparked outrage in Pakistan. The backlash and memefest have forced a U-turn.
Mystery of 105 pillars of light seen over the Himalayas solvedThe discovery confirms that Himalayan thunderstorms can produce some of the world's most complex phenomena.

How British F-35 fighter jet might be dismantled, parcelled to UK from KeralaThe British navy's F-35B fighter jet stuck in Kerala for over a fortnight is reported to be beyond repair and will have to be shipped home. How are fighter jets like the F-35 dismantled and flown in bigger transport aircraft? Here's what we know.

Chess star Vidit Gujrathi calls out LiverDoc for insulting his familyIndian chess grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi engaged in a heated online dispute with X user LiverDoc over his family's medical qualifications.

Not proud but had to do it: Soham Parekh admits to working multiple jobs at onceIndia-based software engineer Soham Parekh has publicly admitted to simultaneously working full-time for multiple startups, in a disclosure that has reignited debates around remote work norms and ethics in the tech industry.

69 dead, 37 missing as flash floods, landslides ravage Himachal amid heavy rainFrom the hills of Shimla to the valleys of Mandi and Sirmaur, the state has witnessed record-breaking downpours in the past 24 hours, with alerts now in place for further intense weather through July 9.

Mind your language: Why linguistic battles in 'New' India won't workThose who might be fighting language wars need to realise that these are losing battles which may yield temporary political dividend but cannot be sustained beyond a point. Linguistic diversity is India's strength, being multilingual a competitive advantage.

Jurassic World Rebirth review: Dinosaurs, mayhem and visual treat with wobbly plotRelease Date:Fri Jul 04, 2025Jurassic World Rebirth movie review: The film returns with thrilling dinosaurs and suspenseful horror. The film impresses visually but struggles with an uneven plot and character development, says our review.

44 injuries, brain damage: Chilling autopsy details of Tamil Nadu custodial deathThe post-mortem report of custodial death victim Ajith Kumar, accessed by India Today, reveals 44 injuries, including deep muscle contusions, brain bleeding, and internal organ trauma. The findings strongly suggest prolonged, violent physical torture leading to death.
Don't seek God in us, seek God in justice: Supreme Court"Don't seek God in us, seek god in justice. We are just humble servants," Justice Sundresh said.

Shux completes over 100 orbits of Earth, gets much-needed day offAxiom Space said that the crew enjoyed a well-earned off-duty day, giving them a chance to recharge and connect with family and friends back on Earth.

Delhi woman recalls 'scary' midnight Blinkit delivery in viral Reddit postA Delhi woman shared a chilling Reddit post about a late-night Blinkit delivery that left her and her sister frightened. She also urged solo women to stay cautious in her post.

Siddaramaiah, Biocon founder spar over vaccine safety amid rise in Hassan deathsBiocon founder Kiran Mazumdar Shaw and Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah debated on X over the safety of Covid-19 vaccines. The exchange began after Shaw called out Siddaramaiah linking the vaccines to a spate of sudden heart-related deaths in Hassan district.

One in 4 Indians still below minimum standard of living: World BankDespite a sharp drop in extreme poverty, about one in four Indians still falls below the level needed to meet essential needs and maintain a minimum standard of living.

Viral video shows Lalit Modi, Vijay Mallya singing together at lavish London partyLalit Modi and Vijay Mallya sing "I Did It My Way" at a grand London party, drawing attention for flaunting wealth despite ongoing investigations in India.

Cheers! Four Indian bars on Asia's 50 Best Bars 2025 extended listThe organisation '50 Best' has announced the 51st to 100th rankings of Asia's Best Bars. The top 50 will be revealed later this month at a live award ceremony in Macau.

Stranded in Kerala, UK's F-35 fighter jet now has an 'Aadhaar Card'. See new memesOne viral post imagining the British Royal Navy's F-35 fighter jet as an Indian citizen, complete with a digitally-generated Aadhaar card that includes its photo, has won the internet.

I got soundly punished: Magnus Carlsen's rare moment of praise for D GukeshWorld No.1 Magnus Carlsen had a rare moment of praise for Indian Grandmaster D Gukesh after getting humbled by the 18-year-old in the SuperUnited Rapid and Blitz Croatia. This is the second time in a row that Gukesh has beaten Magnus.

sports.headline: 2nd Test: Webster, Carey put in yet another rescue act in GrenedaAlex Carey and Beau Webster staged a vital rescue for Australia after a top-order collapse. Their partnership helped stabilise the innings amid a fierce West Indies pace attack.

Chess star Vidit Gujrathi calls out LiverDoc for insulting his familyIndian chess grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi engaged in a heated online dispute with X user LiverDoc over his family's medical qualifications.

Courageous Akash Deep comes back to give England another mini scareENG vs IND: Akash Deep struck crucial early blows, removing Ben Duckett and Ollie Pope to leave England reeling after India posted a commanding 587 in their first innings at Edgbaston, having been asked to bat first.

Wimbledon 2025 Day 5 schedule: Alcaraz, Raducanu headline 3rd round fixturesThe fifth day of the All England championships will see some key clashes in the men's and women's singles divisions. 'Good friends,' Carlos Alcaraz and Emma Raducanu, will be in action on the centre court later today.

Ravindra Jadeja breaks BCCI rules, but unlikely to face sanction: ReportRavindra Jadeja broke the new BCCI travel rules during the second Test against England. However, he is unlikely to get a sanction.

Gill shares father's hilarious reality check: Missed 300ENG vs IND: Shubman Gill's father took a cheeky dig after his son was dismissed at 269 in the 2nd Test at Birmingham. He reckons that he missed out on a triple-hundred.

Team India unlikely to travel to Bangladesh for white ball seriesThe Indian cricket team is unlikely to travel to Bangladesh amidst diplomatic tensions between the two countries. A top source has told India Today that the cricket has been advised to call off the tour.

How Shubman Gill's England Tour began during IPL 2025India captain Shubman Gill scored a commanding 269 in the second Test at Birmingham. Gill revealed that he started training for the series since IPL 2025.

Prince Shubman Gill coronates himself as the new leader of Indian cricketShubman Gill has stamped his authority on the dressing room and has coronated himself as the new leader of Indian cricket. The new Indian skipper has shown what makes him standout from the rest with his impressive 269 against England.

Can India win 2nd Test after 587 in Birmingham? Here's what history saysENG vs IND: India have got themselves in a position of strength in the second Test in Birmingham, but can they go on to win the Test match to draw level in the series?

Ganguly on Shubman Gill's 269: Best Test innings I have ever seen in EnglandShubman Gill played a stunning innings of 269 runs in the second Test against England. His performance was praised by former India captain Sourav Ganguly as the best Test innings ever played in England.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
